page.title: 02CHRIST CHURCH HATHERDEN
page.content: This church, the first in Hatherden, was built in 1857 as a Chapel of Ease to Smannell. In 1873, however, it was made a parish church in its own right. In the early morning of July 8th, 1975 it was struck by lightning and completely gutted by fire. After much prayer and discussion it was decided to rebuild the interior on modern lines, incorporating a Narthex for meetings but retaining the old brick and flint walls.The work was begun on July 8th, 1976, (a year to the day after the fire), and completed in February 1977. The rebuilt church was dedicated by the Rt. Rev. John Taylor, Bishop of Winchester, on Sunday, February 20th, 1977.
